author: _shemnon
content:
Post cancun I think that's safe, may be pre-cancun in the absence of self-destruct
* Contracts either have code or a nonce of 1.  Most have both (are there any pre-spurious dragon conracts with non-1 nonces?). Since code cannot be deleted post EIP-6780 it cannot become empty.
* EOAs may have a balance and zero nonce.  To zero that balance they would need to send a transaction.  EIP-3074 may break this, as an EOA can sign a message authorizing a transfer.  3074 can fix this by having AUTHs increment the nonce.
